## Key References

### Foundational Texts

1. **Caddy, J.F. and Mahon, R.** (1995). Reference points for fisheries management. ICES Journal of Marine Science, 52(3-4), 577-580.

2. **Hilborn, R. and Walters, C.J.** (1992). Quantitative Fisheries Stock Assessment: Choice, Dynamics and Uncertainty. Chapman and Hall, New York.

3. **Quinn II, T.J. and Deriso, R.B.** (1999). Quantitative Fish Dynamics. Oxford University Press, New York.

### Data Collection Methods

4. **Sparre, P. and Venema, S.C.** (1998). Introduction to tropical fish stock assessment. Part 1 - Manual. FAO Fisheries Technical Paper No. 306/1 Rev. 2.

5. **FAO.** (2020). A handbook for the economic analysis of fishery management measures. FAO Fisheries and Aquaculture Circular. Rome.

### Stock Assessment Methods

6. **Haddon, M.** (2011). Modelling and quantitative methods in fisheries. Chapman and Hall/CRC, Boca Raton, FL.

7. **Melnychuk, M.C., Peterson, E., Christensen, V., and Branch, T.A.** (2012). Fisheries management impacts on target species status. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, 109(1), 97-102.

### Data Quality and Validation

8. **Cochran, W.G.** (1977). Sampling Techniques. John Wiley & Sons, New York.

9. **Kell, L.T., Minto, C., and Gerritsen, H.D.** (2016). Evaluation of the RBF4 CPUE standardization approach. Fisheries Research, 183, 220-228.

## Suggested Reading Order

**For Beginners:**
1. Start with Lecture 1: Introduction to Stock Assessment Data
2. Read Sparre & Venema (1998) - Chapters 1-3
3. Complete Lecture 2: Advanced Data Topics
4. Explore FishBase for species examples

**For Advanced Study:**
1. Hilborn & Walters (1992) - Chapters 1-4
2. Haddon (2011) - Part I and II
3. Recent journal articles on specific assessment methods
4. FLR documentation for software applications

## Citation Format

If using materials from this course in academic work:

**Course Materials:**
Peter, N. (2025). Fish Stock Assessment Course (AQ 232) - Lecture Notes. University of [Institution].

**Specific Lecture:**
Peter, N. (2025). Fish Stock Assessment Data. In Fish Stock Assessment Course (AQ 232). Lecture 1. [Date Accessed].
